title: Fort Scott National Historic Site: Centennial Ball
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar     Centennial Ball              Centennial Ball          The Centennial Grand Ball, A Celebration of the 100th Anniversary of the National Park Service, will be held Saturday, September 3rd, 2016 at the historic Memorial Hall in Fort Scott, Kansas. It is being hosted by the Friends of Fort Scott National Historic Site along with volunteers at the site. All proceeds go to the "Friends" group, which will use the funds to support special programs at the historic site..  Doors open at 6:00 p.m.with dancing from 7:00-10:30 p.m.  A popular dance of the era called the Grand March will start promptly at 7:00 p.m. Mid 19th century (1800s) period dress is highly encouraged. Formal dress (fancy party wear) and gloves, which will be available at the ball,  are required.* Dressing rooms are available.  Light refreshments of the period will be served. Tickets will be available starting July 1 at the Fort Scott Chamber of Commerce and Country Cupboard in Fort Scott or by mail by contacting Dee Young. Admission will be as follows   General Public- $15 in advance/$20 at the door per person or two for $25 in advance/$35 at the door. Friends members- $10 in advance/$15 at the door.  Children 12 & Under and Dance Observers- $5. A free dance class (street clothes) will be held Saturday, September 3, from 10-1 in the Grand Hall on the grounds of Fort Scott National Historic Site.  *Long trains, spike heels, hobnails or heel-plates, spurs, swords or side-arms, pipes/cigars/chewing tobacco, and liquor are prohibited.   For more information, contact Dee Young at 913-557-1632/913-269-1632 or by email.  You can also download the attached flyer.   Centennial Ball Flyer
